FuncDef: The display isis system-id conflict command displays information about system ID conflicts (if any).
CLIs: display isis system-id conflict [ level-1 | level-2 ] [ <process-id> | { vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> } ]
display isis [ <process-id> ] system-id conflict [ level-1 | level-2 ]

ParaDef.Info:
Displays information about Level-1 system ID conflicts.
-

Displays information about Level-2 system ID conflicts.
-

Displays information about system ID conflicts in a specified IS-IS process.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.

Displays information about system ID conflicts in a specified VPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. In addition, the VPN instance name must not be _public_. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Examples: End Time            : Conflict may still persist
Detect Result       : A system ID conflict may occur between the local and another devices.
End Time            : Conflict may still persist
Detect Result       : A system ID conflict may occur between two remote devices.
End Time            : Conflict may still persist
Detect Result       : A system ID conflict may occur between the local and another devices.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To check information about system ID conflicts (if any), run the display isis system-id conflict command. The command output helps with troubleshooting.
